docs.snippet: A ruling party official apologized to South Korean reporters at their hotel after they were kept from a concert in Pyongyang attended by Kim Jong-un.

headline.print_headline: North Korea Offers Regrets For Barring Media at Show
headline.main: North Korea Issues Rare Apology Over Media Access to K-Pop Show

docs.snippet: The last Syrian rebel group in eastern Ghouta near Damascus began withdrawing on Monday under an agreement with the government, state media said, though a military source said a group of insurgents were still rejecting the deal.

headline.print_headline: Syrian State Media: Last Rebel Group Starts Leaving Ghouta
headline.main: Syrian State Media: Last Rebel Group Starts Leaving Ghouta

docs.snippet: Republican Marc Molinaro vowed Monday to change what he called Albany's climate of corruption and behind-closed-doors deals as he formally kicked off his campaign for New York governor.

headline.print_headline: Republican Molinaro Kicks Off Campaign for New York Governor
headline.main: Republican Molinaro Kicks Off Campaign for New York Governor

docs.snippet: He can’t change the president, but he can get back to trying to solve problems in the real world.

headline.print_headline: A Plan to Save the State Department
headline.main: Samantha Power: How Mike Pompeo Could Save the State Department

docs.snippet: China has increased tariffs by up to 25 percent on 128 U.S. products, from frozen pork and wine to certain fruits and nuts, escalating a dispute between the world's biggest economies in response to U.S. duties on imports of aluminum and steel.

headline.print_headline: China Hits U.S. Goods With Tariffs as 'Sparks' of Trade War Fly
headline.main: China Hits U.S. Goods With Tariffs as 'Sparks' of Trade War Fly

docs.snippet: Premier Li Keqiang said on Monday China and the United States  should maintain negotiations and he reiterated pledges to ease access for American businesses, as China scrambles to avert a trade war.

headline.print_headline: China's Premier Pledges Market Opening in Bid to Avert U.S. Trade War
headline.main: China's Premier Pledges Market Opening in Bid to Avert U.S. Trade War
